title: 56. Could Prison Be Good for Your Health?
description: Incarceration has been linked to infectious diseases, mental illness, cancer, and violence. But new research suggests it can extend some people’s lifespans. Bapu investigates the paradox of prison time.
author: bapu@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: Incarceration has been linked to infectious diseases, mental illness, cancer, and violence. But new research suggests it can extend some people’s lifespans. Bapu investigates the paradox of prison time.
